title: Cannot build std for `*-apple-watchos*` targets
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

Since `*-apple-watchos*` are Tier 3 targets without a precompiled std lib, I need to build one

I tried this code:

```bash
cargo +nightly -Zbuild-std --target=aarch64-apple-watchos-sim
```

I expected to see this happen: build the hello world successfully

Instead, this happened: 
```
error[E0432]: unresolved import `super::platform::fs`
 --> /Users/inflation/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/os/unix/fs.rs:7:22
  |
7 | use super::platform::fs::MetadataExt as _;
  |                      ^^ could not find `fs` in `platform`

error[E0432]: unresolved import `super::platform::raw`
  --> /Users/inflation/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/os/unix/raw.rs:27:26
   |
27 | pub use super::platform::raw::pthread_t;
   |                          ^^^ could not find `raw` in `platform`

error[E0432]: unresolved import `super::platform::raw`
  --> /Users/inflation/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/os/unix/raw.rs:30:26
   |
30 | pub use super::platform::raw::{blkcnt_t, time_t};
   |                          ^^^ could not find `raw` in `platform`

error[E0432]: unresolved imports `super::platform::raw`, `crate::os::unix::raw::pthread_t`
  --> /Users/inflation/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/os/unix/raw.rs:33:26
   |
33 | pub use super::platform::raw::{blksize_t, dev_t, ino_t, mode_t, nlink_t, off_t};
   |                          ^^^ could not find `raw` in `platform`
   |
  ::: /Users/inflation/.rustup/toolchains/nightly-aarch64-apple-darwin/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/std/src/os/unix/thread.rs:8:5
   |
8  | use crate::os::unix::raw::pthread_t;
   |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.64.0-nightly (2643b1646 2022-07-27)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2643b16468fda787470340890212591d8bc832b7
commit-date: 2022-07-27
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.64.0-nightly
LLVM version: 14.0.6
```

It turns out some platform-specific definitions are missing. Using the iOS counterpart in place compiles successfully. Then I double-checked their header files in SDKs and confirmed they are the same between the two for the definitions.

It's a small change, and I'm happy to open a PR for it.
